result.execSummary:
The defendant Carissa K Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. 

DE will continue counseling and treatment per the direction of DOC agent.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge. 

2022GF77 CONSOLIDATED INTO 2022CF79

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carissa K Jordan

records.addlTxt:
3:37 PM Defendant Carissa K Jordan appeared by video.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Carissa K Jordan.  Attorney scott H dirks in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached in this case.  DE will waive PH, court instructs on waiver of PH. DE understands waiver of PH, makes waiver knowingly, freely, voluntarily and intelligently, court will accept waiver of PH. 

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea, finds DE guilty. 

Days credit will be added to JOC if any.  Adj 4:07pm

records.addlTxt: No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.
Review hearing on June 20, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

01:05 PM Defendant Carissa K Jordan in court with attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg.  Defendant Carissa K Jordan in custody.  Scott H Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per SP Dirks DOC  Agent is looking for placement for DE in a halfway house, State would like a sign bond with all conditions remaining.  Court advises DE of potential charges.    Waive formal reading of the CC. 

 $2500.00 sign bonds,   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  

DE/Atty will waive TL for PH, court instructs, DE understands, court will accept waiver of TL.  Set for RH JUne 20, 2022 @ 3:45PM. Adj 1:12pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5)
